page.title: 04The Village Shop in Langford
page.content: There is only one shop in the area which sells food, household cleaners, washing powders, batteries and light bulbs. The owners run the shop and do not employ anyone. The shop is open six hours a day and for six days a week. In the first six months of 1985 they sold four hundred loaves of bread. The average number of customers during the week is between twelve and twenty and at the weekend between twenty and thirty. Less than forty percent of the people in Langford use the village shop. There is a mobile shop that visits the village twice a week. It sells bread, cakes, biscuits, fruit, sweets, crisps and other food.
